project.teaser: SEMPRE-BIO aims to demonstrate novel and cost-effective biomethane production solutions and pathways, deemed essential to achieve the European Green Deal and climate and energy targets for 2030 and the net zero greenhouse gas emissions by 2050, and to increase the market...
project.objective: SEMPRE-BIO aims to demonstrate novel and cost-effective biomethane production solutions and pathways, deemed essential to achieve the European Green Deal and climate and energy targets for 2030 and the net zero greenhouse gas emissions by 2050, and to increase the market up-take of biomethane related technologies. To that extent, SEMPRE-BIO will set up three European Biomethane Innovation Ecosystems (EBIEs), based in Baix Llobregat (ES), Bourges (FR) and Adinkerke (BE), which are representative of the different baseline situations for biomethane production across Europe Those initial EBIEs will facilitate long-term replication, by creating an active flow of information and resources for ideas to transform into reality. Through the EBIEs, SEMPRE-BIO will build a process by which more innovators and entrepreneurs will be able develop and launch solutions to solve problems related to the larger-scale and cheaper production of biomethane, faster. This process will create new technical expertise, helping to diversify the technology portfolio, and will allows businesses to better know their potential customers. Additionally, EBIEs will provide the means to create economic stability and resource sharing. The value of EBIEs lies in the access to resources for the start-ups and the flow of information for the ecosystem’s stakeholders. This information flow will create more future investment opportunities for the right institutions to connect with the right ideas for their businesses and portfolios, at the right time, for the right reasons. Overall, the challenge is to decrease investment and operational costs, to optimize feedstock supply, use, identify alternative feedstock as well as reduce their costs, to improve plant efficiency and operations, to factor in the carbon savings and to increase and monetize co-benefits, such as from the commercialization of the digestate or the valorization of residual gas streams.
project.title: SEcuring doMestic PRoduction of cost-Effective BIOmethane
project.keywords: Biomethane, Upgrading, Methanation, Syngas, Cryo-Separation, CO2 Valorization, Green Deal, Innovation Ecosystems

webItem.title: Filling the tank
webItem.alternativeText: An illustration of the contributions made by each source to the overall goal of 35 billion cubic metres of biomethane production, rendered as liquid levels in a large cylindrical gas tower.

webItem.title: Fuelling innovation
webItem.alternativeText: An illustration showing how the various elements support biomethane production. Artificial photosynthesis supplies the gas network directly. Wood biomass is gasified and sent to the gas network. Waste waters and organic matter feed the anaerobic digester, which produces biogas that is refined to biomethane before being injected into the gas network. Waste from the city, including CO2, is returned to the anaerobic digester.

webItem.title: Investing in a greener future
webItem.alternativeText: An illustration showing the value of projects in millions of euro, arranged by funding stream. Coordination and Support Actions include Bin2Grid (0.71), BiogasAction (2.0), BIOSURF (1.87), DiBiCoo (3), ISAAC (1.48), ISABEL (1.9) and REGATRACE (3). Research and Innovation Actions include CarbonNeutralLNG (3.31), CRONUS (4.39), DESIRED (3.06), FlexSNG (4.23), NET-Fuels (4.50) and PRODIGIO (2.45). Innovation Actions include BIOMETHAVERSE (9.87), HYFUELUP (10.29), METHAREN (10.36) and SEMPRE-BIO (11.75).

category.title: Projects Information Pack
category.description: Article: Selections of projects in their early stages focusing on a specific research theme

article.teaser: Europe’s energy security is under pressure from rising costs, climate change, domestic and international energy policy, and conflict. Biomethane – natural gas produced from renewable sources such as municipal and agricultural waste – offers a reliable, drop-in fuel that can meet the energy needs of citizens. This Projects Info Pack showcases the research being carried out to grow Europe’s biomethane industry, boosting energy security and helping to deliver on the EU’s ambitions for a competitive, low-carbon economy.

article.teaser: New biomethane technologies will help Europe wean itself off Russia’s fossil fuels. An EU-funded project is helping transform these ideas into reality through European Biomethane Innovation Ecosystems.

article.title: Innovative biomethane to support Europe’s energy independence
article.teaser: A new Projects Info Pack from CORDIS highlights the ongoing research helping to deliver REPowerEU’s goal of ending reliance on Russian gas imports by 2030 and accelerating Europe’s transition to a clean energy system.

category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: IP Strategy Plan
result.description: Document resulting from T6.3 containing the appropriate strategies for protection and future exploitation of the SEMPRE-BIO project results, including patenting, licensing and/or replicating strategies.

result.title: Risk Management Plan v2
result.description: Second version of the report on potential risks during the execution of the project and related recovery actions, setting mitigation actions (T7.2). New risks are expected to arise as the project develops, for which new mitigation strategies will have to be drafted.

result.title: Carbon monoxide inhibition on acidogenic glucose fermentation and aceticlastic methanogenesis

details.authors: Pietro Postacchini, Antonio Grimalt-Alemany, Parisa Ghofrani-Isfahani, Laura Treu, Stefano Campanaro, Lorenzo Menin, Francesco Patuzzi, Marco Baratieri, Irini Angelidaki

result.title: Risk Management Plan v1
result.description: First report on potential risks during the execution of the project and related recovery actions, setting mitigation actions (T7.2). New risks are expected to arise as the project develops, for which new mitigation strategies will have to be drafted.

result.title: Research Ethics and Data Protection Monitoring Report v1
result.description: First report of research ethics guidelines, recommendations, and related monitoring activities (T7.4). In this report, several facets of reserach ethics will be addressed. Among them, intellectual property and confidentiality and privacy of results.

result.title: From microbial heterogeneity to evolutionary insights: A strain-resolved metagenomic study of H2S-induced changes in anaerobic biofilms

details.authors: Gabriele Ghiotto, Nicola De Bernardini, Ginevra Giangeri, Panagiotis Tsapekos, Maria Gaspari, Panagiotis G. Kougias, Stefano Campanaro, Irini Angelidaki, Laura Treu

result.title: Data Management Plan v2
result.description: It describes the data management life cycle for the data to be collected, processed and/or generated by the project (T7.4 Data requirements planning and management). It will contribute to open access of research data.

result.title: SEMPRE-BIO website and promotional video
result.description: Website available to all partners for publication of the project results and tools developed in the project and any related relevant news as well as targeted dissemination activities. A beta version of the website will be available by month 4. Recording of one short promotional video for dissemination of the project with focus on relevant stakeholders. This deliverable is a result of T6.2.

result.title: Dissemination, communication, and exploitation plan
result.description: Set of activities planned in T6.1 to create awareness of the project, its development, and results, steered towards different stakeholder groups to increase project impact, as well as end-user and stakeholder engagement.

result.title: Joint policy recommendations. Cluster of Horizon Europe-funded projects on innovative biomethane production.
result.description: Joint deliverable under Task 5.4, in collaboration with projects funded under topic HORIZON-CL5-2021-D3-03-16 (101084148 HYFUELUP, 101084200 BIOMETHAVERSE, 101084288 METHAREN), including guidelines and recommendations to policy makers. Updated in M24 and M42. Project SEMPRE-BIO will be in charge of coordinating the first delivery (M12), HYFUELUP the second (M24) and BIOMETHAVERSE the final (M42).

result.title: Report with the current state, progress made up to date and future challenges of advanced technologies for efficient CO2 valorisation at multiple scales, from pilot to market scale, in the European Union
result.description: State of the art to valorize CO2 through biological processes (T4.1): The report contains the state of the art of the CO2 valorization focusing on main purposes (e.g. material utilisation of CO2 in the chemical industry for the production of basic chemicals, in the food industry, packaging industry, etc.). Thereby, as a result EU-wide locations of (pilot) plants, plant capacities, respective advanced technologies, the TRL of the respective technology, value-added specific products resulting from valorization of CO2 and process productivity (if available) will be provided (in form of data visualization/maps and tables). Moreover, different scales in the EU will be considered with respect to the progress made up to date and future challenges of advanced technologies.

result.title: Stakeholder mapping for each EBIE
result.description: Results of activities performed in T1.2 (Designing and organising SEMPRE-BIO European Biomethane Innovation Ecosystems), mainly stakeholder mapping as well as the definition of practices, methodologies, and tools to meet the objectives defined for the SEMPRE-BIO EBIEs’ operation, and the timeline for their implementation.

category.title: innovation management
category.displayCode: /social sciences/economics and business/business and management/innovation management

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
